Wisatawan Girang Pesta Halloween di Bali Begitu Berkesan
01 Nov 2019, 10:43 by Antara, Rini Kustiani
TEMPO.CO, Badung - Bali sebagai destinasi wisata populer bagi wisatawan mancanegara menghadirkan suasana Halloween yang berkesan. Sejumlah hotel, restoran, sampai bandara di Bali menggelar pesta Halloween dengan cara yang unik.
Di Hotel The Jayakarta, Legian, Badung, Bali, misalnya, seluruh pegawai hotel tampil seram khas Halloween pada Kamis malam, 31 Oktober 2019. "Malam ini semua staf berdandan menyeramkan dan kami terhibur," ujar Ben, wisatawan asal Sydney, Australia yang mengikuti pesta Halloween di hotel tersebut.
Ternyata bukan hanya pegawai hotel yang tampil dengan kostum dan makeup seram, aneka makanan dan minuman di hotel itu juga terbilang mengerikan. Misalnya, ada daging yang disusun hingga menyerupai wajah zombie dan bakso yang dibentuk seperti bola mata. "Itu unik sekali," kata Ben.
General Manager The Jakayakarta Bali, Agus Tabah mengatakan keunikan di malam Halloween ini diadakan untuk memberikan pengalaman menarik dan berkesan bagi para tamu. Musababnya, sebagian besar tamu di hotel itu adalah wisatawan mancanegara. "Kami berharap berbagai kegiatan, seperti lomba merias wajah dengan dandanan menyeramkan dan makan malam bertema Halloween bisa menjadi atraksi yang menarik bagi mereka," katanya.
Agus Tabah berharap para tamu yang datang dan menikmati keseruan pesta Halloween di hotel itu menyebarluaskan kegembiraan mereka di media sosial masing-masing. Dengan begitu, informasi terkait aktivitas di hotel akan sampai ke luar negeri.
Selain di hotel, perayaan Halloween di Bali juga diadakan di Bandara Internasional I Gusti Ngurah Rai. Bandara ini menerapkan dengan nuansa Halloween melalui cat berwarna hitam lengkap dengan dekorasi seram. "Kami memadukan tampilan Halloween dengan keceriaan khas Bandara Ngurah Rai. Suasana ini tidak ditemui di bandara lain," ujar Rahmat Adil Indrawan, Co General Manager Commercial PT Angkasa Pura I (Persero) Bandara Internasional I Gusti Ngurah Rai, Bali.
Di Terminal Keberangkatan Domestik dan Internasional Bandara I Gusti Ngurah Rai, ada tempat untuk berfoto berupa diorama tiga dimensi Halloween Pumpkin Photobooth. Booth tersebut didekorasi dengan boneka menyeramkan beserta labu dan tulisan Halloween berukuran besar yang dapat menyala. Adapun di Terminal Keberangkatan Domestik, area Taman Anggrek dihias dengan suasana Taman Labu yang dilengkapi gapura Halloween serta ornamen daun kering serta labu Jack-o’-Lantern.

Travelers for Halloween Party in Bali are so memorable
01 Nov 2019, 10:43 by Antara, Rini Kustiani
TEMPO.CO, Badung - Bali as a popular tourist destination for foreign tourists presents a memorable Halloween atmosphere. A number of hotels, restaurants, to the airport in Bali held a Halloween party in a unique way.
At The Jayakarta Hotel, Legian, Badung, Bali, for example, all hotel employees performed Halloween-style scary on Thursday night, October 31, 2019. "Tonight all the staff dress up creepy and we were entertained," said Ben, tourists from Sydney, Australia who followed Halloween party at the hotel.
It turned out that not only hotel employees who appeared with scary costumes and makeup, various foods and drinks in the hotel were also somewhat terrible. For example, there is meat that is arranged so that it resembles the face of a zombie and meatballs that are shaped like eyeballs. "That's very unique," said Ben.
The General Manager of The Jakayakarta Bali, Agus Tabah said the uniqueness on Halloween night was held to provide an interesting and memorable experience for guests. The reason, most of the guests at the hotel are foreign tourists. "We hope that various activities, such as a makeup contest with creepy makeup and a Halloween-themed dinner can be an interesting attraction for them," he said.
Agus Tabah hopes that the guests who come and enjoy the excitement of the Halloween party at the hotel will spread their joy on their respective social media. That way, information related to activities at the hotel will get abroad.
Besides at the hotel, Halloween celebrations in Bali are also held at I Gusti Ngurah Rai International Airport. The airport is applied with a Halloween feel through black paint complete with spooky decorations. "We combine Halloween's look with the typical cheerfulness of Ngurah Rai Airport. This atmosphere is not found in other airports," said Rahmat Adil Indrawan, Commercial General Manager of PT Angkasa Pura I (Persero) I Gusti Ngurah Rai International Airport, Bali.
At the Domestic and International Departure Terminal I Gusti Ngurah Rai Airport, there is a place to take pictures in the form of a three-dimensional diorama of Halloween Pumpkin Photobooth. The booth was decorated with creepy dolls and pumpkins and large, lighted Halloween writing. As for the Domestic Departure Terminal, the Orchid Garden area is decorated with the atmosphere of Pumpkin Park which features a Halloween gate and ornaments of dried leaves and Jack-o’-Lantern pumpkin.
